snippet: The new Oscar voting rules cause confusion again, this time over why there are only 5 spots for best picture, when 10 can be nominated.
abstract: The new Oscar voting rules cause confusion again, this time over why there are only 5 spots for best picture, when 10 can be nominated.
lead_paragraph: The Oscar nomination ballots were mailed out last week - they are due back on Jan. 13 - and the new voting rules are already causing problems. It's not quite a debacle on the order of hanging chads, but as Scott Feinberg writes at The Hollywood Reporter, some voters are perplexed about why the ballot only has five spaces for best picture, when there can be up to 10 nominees.

headline.main: Oscar Ballot Doesn't Add Up for Some Voters
